item.title: Simple mathematical tricks in Python
item.description: In this post, you can find some helpful mathematical tips and tricks in the Python programming language. Eigenvalue Level Repulsion Imaging we have two matrices ${\bf A}, {\bf B}$ $\in \mathbb{R}^n$, that are both symmetric. Then, we know that both matrices have $n$ eigenvalues (multiplicity). Let’s start now, gradually morphing ${\bf A}$ to ${\bf B}$ using the following formula $$ {\bf A}[t] = (1 - t) {\bf A} + t {\bf B}, $$
